value: Topanga, viewed from the Topanga Overlook
Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area

. Topanga has long been a getaway for artists and musicians, and it still retains a distinct bohemian flavor, which is complemented by the outdoor enthusiasts who have escaped the urban tangle to be closer to nature.
Topanga can be reached most directly by taking Topanga Canyon Boulevard north from
. Old Topanga Canyon Road and La Tuna Canyon Road are also available, but are older and more indirect routes.

value: price=$20. Child and Senior discount available.

content=An annual music festival held over Memorial Day weekend. Not genre-specific, but tending toward classic rock and folk rock. Capped off by a parade, celebrating the community's counter-cultural roots, along Topanga Canyon Blvd. Parking and tickets are first-come-first-serve, so arrive punctually.
content=An eclectic outdoor theater in Topanga Canyon, featuring folk plays, Shakespeare, educational workshops, and concerts. Founded by actor Will Geer. June through October only.

content=Not every visitor will be in the market for home decor, but jewelry other small pieces are available. Most importantly, this store is perhaps the exemplar of Topanga's local flavor. Asian objets d'art are displayed in an outdoor showroom, complete with natural waterfall.

content=An idyllic (if pricey) outdoor dining experience beside Topanga Creek. All-organic menu featuring locally produced ingredients perfectly complement the adjunct new-age bookstore and shop that echoes Topanga's bohemian history.

content=French / American Bistro located near where the old road joins Topanga Canyon Boulevard. On the pricey side, but the intimate setting and food quality one expects from Topanga mean you get what you pay for.
content=Small coffee shop south of "downtown" Topanga. Offers baked goods and a modest breakfast and lunch menu, and a small patio as well.
content=A secluded Bed and Breakfast off Topanga Canyon Boulevard.
content=A luxury Bed and Breakfast located on Topanga Canyon Boulevard.

- An exclusive costal community and home to the rich and famous, and features miles of beautiful public beaches.
- An upscale, mostly residential community overlooking the ocean. The J. Paul Getty Villa museum is located here.
- A popular tourist destination with a famous pier and the 3rd Street Promenade shopping center.
